abstract: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles reports second-quarter net income of 333 million euros, or about $363 million, up 69 percent from year-earlier period; reports revenue of 29.2 billion euros, or about $31.8 billion, up 25 percent from one year earlier; impressive results drive shares up 7.3 percent.
lead_paragraph: The popular Jeep sport utility vehicles and higher profit margins were behind the increase, and the carmaker says a penalty for safety violations won’t slow it down.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler Profit Increases 69%, Most of It From North America
headline.print_headline: Fiat Chrysler Profit Increases 69%, Most of It From North America

snippet: The popular Jeep sport utility vehicles and higher profit margins were behind the increase, and the carmaker says a penalty for safety violations won’t slow it down.
